question_text: What does BSS for Protection Against Ionizing Radiation mean?
Which of the following factors is NOT relevant to dose reduction?
Which of the following areas of practice is classified as controlled area rather than supervised area?
Which of the following is true of radiation exposure?

options.A: All workers in the controlled and supervised areas should be monitored
options.B: One dosimeter is assigned to all the personnel in the unit and should be endorsed to the one on duty
options.C: The monitoring device should be worn on the front of the upper torso of the body

question_text: Which of the following set-up results in the highest radiation field in the vicinity of the patient and higher exposure to the staff?
In which of the following settings is radiation exposure NOT medically warranted?

A 72-year old male with prostate cancer undergoing brachytherapy is accompanied by his caregiver during his sessions. What is the maximum allowed dose for the caregiver during the patient's brachytherapy session?
Accidental exposure to both patients and staff are more likely to occur in which of the following procedures? (IAEA p. 47)
Which of the following will LEAST LIKELY cause severe radiation injuries like ulceration and necrotic tissue?

options.A: Very short distance from X-ray focus to patient
options.B: Use of high dose-rate mode for a time much longer than necessary
options.C: Malfunction of the automatic exposure control systems
options.D: Projection exposing different areas of the skin

question_text: What biological effect of radiation requires a threshold dose, with notable increase in severity as the dose increases?
Which of the following statements DOES NOT describe stochastic effect of radiation?

options.A: A dose threshold should be exceeded to produce the effect
options.B: Includes radiation-induced carcinoma and hereditary effects
options.C: Probability is increased with increasing dose
options.D: Regarded as principal health risk from low-dose radiation

question_text: Which organ has a highest relative radiosensitivity?
What is the ratio of cancer incidence in the exposed population to that in the unexposed population?
Which of the following statements is true about radiation-induced thyroid carcinoma?

options.A: Age is not a contributory factor
options.B: Internally deposited radionuclides has increased cancer risk compared to external radiation from x-rays
options.C: Majority are well differentiated papillary carcinomas
options.D: Men are 2-3 times at greater risk

question_text: What stage of gestation do embryos exhibit "all or nothing" response to radiation exposure?
Which among the following fetal effects from low-dose radiation is more likely to happen during the first week of gestation?
Which among these personnel dosimeters is most used because it is inexpensive, lightweight and can provide a permanent record of occupational radiation exposure?
What is the most used shielding material from radiation?
Which of the following tissue characteristics is not a basis of analysis in magnetic resonance imaging?

options.D: T1 and T2 relaxation times of tissue

question_text: Which of the following features is compatible with T2?

options.A: It conveys how quickly a given tissue loses its magnetization.
options.B: It is a decrease or increase in signal intensity within blood vessels.
options.C: It is a measure of a proton's ability to exchange energy with its surrounding chemical matrix.
options.D: It is a measure of how quickly a tissue can become magnetized.

question_text: Which of the following statements correctly describe a standard T1WI?

options.A: It is obtained by selecting long time of repetition (TR) and short time of echo (TE)
options.B: It is obtained by selecting short TR and long TE
options.C: Tissues with long T1 value appear bright and short T1 value appear dark
options.D: Tissues with short T1 value appear bright and long T1 value appear dark

question_text: The time between administered radiofrequency pulses pertains to which of the following settings?
Which of the following principles is true for STIR (short TI inversion recovery) pulse sequence?

options.A: All tissues with short T1 relaxation times are suppressed.
options.B: STIR images more strongly resembles T1WI.
options.C: STIR pulse sequence demonstrates bright signal for fat.
options.D: Tissues with high water content are suppressed.

question_text: Which of the following findings correctly describe gradient recalled echo (GRE) sequence?

options.A: Demonstrates flowing blood with high signal
options.B: Depict calcification with high signal, thus differentiating it from hemorrhage with dark signal

question_text: Which of the following structures will show absent signal on T2WI?
Which of the following characteristics is true for gadolinium chelate?
Which of the following MR artifact occur when anatomy outside the designated field of view but within the image plane is mismapped onto the opposite side of the image?
Which of the following detector systems uses a photostimulable phosphor detector usually composed of a mixture of BaFBr (barium fluorohalide)?
What standard x-ray source-to-image distance (SID) is used in most table-based radiographic systems?

Communication among the Radiology Information System (RIS), Hospital Information System (HIS), Electronic Medical Record (EMR) and Picture Archiving and Communication Systems (PACS) for the electronic exchange of alphanumeric medical information, such as administrative information and clinical laboratory data is often implemented using what standard?

options.A: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM)

question_text: What DICOM standard provides the registry of patients for imaging on specific imaging devices?
Which of the following physical connections used in the exchange of information between computers is NOT affected by electrical interference and thus has lower error rates?
What network topology is described by a Radiology department whose local-area network consists of several nodes connecting to a central node, called a hub?
The contrast resolution of a monitor is mainly determined by what parameter?
What storage device stores digital information as small electrical charges and does not require electrical power to maintain the stored information?
Which of the following parameters can improve the spatial resolution of an image?
Gamma rays are employed in which of the following imaging modality?

Among the particulate radiations, which particle when emitted inside the body causes more extensive cellular damage per unit energy deposited in tissue than any type of radiation used in medical imaging?
Which of the following imaging modalities has the highest spatial resolution (0.03 mm)?
MRI utilizes the nuclear magnetic resonance properties of which chemical element to produce images?
Use of a grid on a standard fluoroscopy unit would reduce which of the following?
What is the most effective way to reduce patient dose during fluoroscopy?
During fluoroscopy, which of the following is a dose reduction technique for patients?

options.A: Aggressive use of high frame rate pulsed fluoroscopy
options.D: Decreasing distance of skin and x-ray tube

question_text: Which is the predominant interaction of X-ray and gamma ray photons in the diagnostic energy range with soft tissue?
Which is by far the most common nuclear medicine imaging device?
What is the most common anode target material used in mammography?
What is the mechanical energy that propagates through a continuous, elastic medium by the compression and rarefaction of particles that comprise it?

The speed of sound is dependent on the propagation of medium and varies widely in different materials. Which of the following tissues or materials is a highly compressible medium that has a low speed of sound?
What is a conduit of tissue that allows ultrasound transmission through structures such as lung?
What kind of array transducer is with the largest transducer assemblies containing 256 to 512 elements and produces a rectangular field of view?
What form of ultrasound artifact is often called a "comet-tail" artifact?
What echo display mode is a technique that uses brightness mode information to display the echoes from moving organ?
What is a hypointense signal area seen distal to an object or interface and is caused by objects with high attenuation or reflection of the incident beam without the return of echoes?

Which of the following CT scan machine components allows the x-ray beams striking the detector to be more uniform by reducing the intensity of the incident x-ray beam in the periphery of the x-ray field?
Which component of a solid-state detector used in multidetector CT scan machines fluoresces when struck by x-ray photons?
What do you call the CT image acquired in a multidetector CT machine wherein the x-ray tube and detector arrays are in stationary position while the patient is translated through the gantry?
In helical CT scan imaging, what do you call the table feed distance per 360-degree rotation of the gantry?
In CT angiography, vascular anatomy is best highlighted in contrast-enhanced images in which post-processing technique?
Which of the following statements is true regarding Dual Energy CT scanning?

options.A: Two sets of images are acquired simultaneously by using two different mA settings.
options.B: Two sets of images are acquired, first using a high mA setting then a second set of images is acquired using a low mA setting and the two sets of images are combined.
options.C: Two sets of images are acquired simultaneously or sequentially using low and high kV settings.
options.D: Two sets of images are acquired using two x-ray sources of the same size producing different voltages.

question_text: What CT scan artifact occurs when the attenuation levels of a region in the patient are excessive exceeding the dynamic range of the detector systems?
